description: a(n) = number of forests with n (unlabeled) nodes in which each component tree is planted, that is, is a rooted tree in which the root has degree 1.
references: E. M. Palmer and A. J. Schwenk, On the number of trees in a random forest, J. Combin. Theory, B 27 (1979), 109-121.
N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_. Definition clarified and more terms added from Palmer-Schwenk by _N. J. A. Sloane_, May 29 2012
